perturbation.original_text: iPASS AND ALL iPASS SUPPLIERS EXPRESSLY DISCLAIM ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES, CONDITIONS, AND REPRESENTATIONS OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY,INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NEITHER iPASS NOR ANY iPASS SUPPLIER WILL BE LIABLE FOR ANY THIRD-PARTY NETWORK FAILURE. iPASS AND ITS SUPPLIERS SPECIFICALLY DO NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES WILL MEET CHANNEL PARTNER'S OR END USER REQUIREMENTS, WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE, ERROR FREE, AVAILABLE ON A SPECIFIED DATE OR TIME OR WILL HAVE THE CAPACITY TO MEET CHANNEL PARTNER'S OR END USER DEMAND DURING SPECIFIC HOURS. CHANNEL PARTNER ACKNOWLEDGES THAT IT HAS NOT ENTERED INTO THIS AGREEMENT IN RELIANCE UPON ANY WARRANTY OR REPRESENTATION.
perturbation.changed_text: iPASS AND ALL iPASS SUPPLIERS DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, CONDITIONS, AND REPRESENTATIONS OF ANY KIND. iPASS AND ITS SUPPLIERS DO NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR FREE. CHANNEL PARTNER ACKNOWLEDGES THAT IT HAS NOT ENTERED INTO THIS AGREEMENT IN RELIANCE UPON ANY WARRANTY OR REPRESENTATION.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the disclaimer of implied warranties of MERCHANTABILITY and FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, the contract initially protects iPass. By removing 'INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE' it could be seen as not giving consumers the right to products that function for their intended use or of reasonable quality, violating consumer protection laws. The removal of 'TIMELY, SECURE, AVAILABLE ON A SPECIFIED DATE OR TIME OR WILL HAVE THE CAPACITY TO MEET CHANNEL PARTNER'S OR END USER DEMAND DURING SPECIFIC HOURS' undermines expectations of service reliability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction, but generally violates implied warranty laws and consumer protection acts (e.g., California Consumer Rights Act, implied warranty provisions under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC)).

perturbation.original_text: The laws of California shall govern the construction and enforceability of the Agreement. The parties agree that any action arising under or relating to the Agreement or the Licensed Software or Services shall lie within the exclusive jurisdiction of the Courts located in San Mateo County, California, USA. The United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods will not apply to the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The laws of California shall govern the construction and enforceability of the Agreement. The parties agree that any action arising under or relating to the Agreement or the Licensed Software or Services shall lie within the exclusive jurisdiction of the Courts located in San Mateo County, California, USA.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the sentence 'The United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods will not apply to the Agreement.' creates uncertainty regarding the agreement's applicability to international transactions. For Channel Partners operating internationally, this may unintentionally subject the agreement to the CISG, which could contradict intended California law and create legal risks. This undermines consumer rights concerning international transactions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (CISG).

perturbation.original_text: iPass may, upon reasonable notice to Channel Partner, directly contact End Users for any reason pertaining to such End User's use of the Service, subject to compliance with local privacy law. Should an End User communicate to Channel Partner or to iPass its dissatisfaction regarding the Services or related matters, the notified party shall promptly give notice to the other party, and iPass and Channel Partner shall work together in good faith to resolve the issue to End User's reasonable satisfaction. If in iPass' reasonable determination the issue is not resolved within thirty (30) days after Channel Partner's receipt of notice of End User's dissatisfaction, iPass may, in addition to other remedies available to iPass, revoke Channel Partner's appointment under Section 1.2 wholly or with respect to such End User and may refer such End User to another iPass channel partner or provide services directly to such End User without any liability to Channel Partner.
perturbation.changed_text: iPass may directly contact End Users for any reason pertaining to such End User's use of the Service. Should an End User communicate to Channel Partner or to iPass its dissatisfaction regarding the Services or related matters, the notified party shall promptly give notice to the other party, and iPass and Channel Partner shall resolve the issue. If the issue is not resolved, iPass may, in addition to other remedies available to iPass, revoke Channel Partner's appointment under Section 1.2 wholly or with respect to such End User and may refer such End User to another iPass channel partner or provide services directly to such End User without any liability to Channel Partner.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'upon reasonable notice to Channel Partner, subject to compliance with local privacy law' and 'work together in good faith to resolve the issue to End User's reasonable satisfaction. If in iPass' reasonable determination the issue is not resolved within thirty (30) days after Channel Partner's receipt of notice of End User's dissatisfaction', the modification removes consumer protection requirements. By taking the phrases away, the changes introduce a legal contradiction as iPass is no longer legally obligated to resolve the issue 'to End User's reasonable satisfaction' nor are they required to comply with local privacy law, which is a needed consumer protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction, but potentially violates privacy laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and consumer protection laws requiring good faith resolution of disputes.
